question.title: JPro classes in Heroku
question.body:
After creating a Profile with run command

java -jar target/fractals-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar -Dserver.port=9090 -Xmx512m

system gives:

Error: Could not find or load main class com.fractals.sierpinski.SierpinskiMain
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/jpro/webapi/JProApplication"

because jpro maven plugin is not executed to archive-compile classes. The usual run command is

mvn clean install jpro:run

which I cannot run. Can you tell me a solution to this problem, please?

question_comments.body: Also, if you have a Heroku Procfile, please include that in the question, too. Right now, there’s not enough info in the question to understand how this is expected to work. We’ll need to see any relevant configuration, or ideally a minimal reproducible example

Please include your pom.xml in the question. It sounds like it’s missing a dependency on the JPro API in the built artifact. Maven does not bundle dependencies into the main JAR artifact by default, so are you configuring something to package the dependencies?
